intro: Adenopus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian adenopus, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, making it visually distinct. Adenopus abyssinicus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
